SEARCH

Class VocabList

java.lang.Object
VocabList
public class VocabList extends Object
The double linked list class, titled VocabList, used to hold VocabNodes which themselves have single-linked WordLists. Also contains the classes VocabNode, WordList, WordNode.

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes
    Modifier and Type
    Class
    Description
    class 
    VocabList.Vocab
    Vocab object "an object wrapping a topic name and the vocabulary words associated with that topic."
    private class 
    VocabList.VocabNode
    The node object for the doubly linked VocabList.
    class 
    VocabList.WordList
    The single linked list class, titled WordList, used to hold WordNodes which contain Strings associated to the words in each topic.

  • Field Details

    • loading

      public static boolean loading
      Static boolean value to tell the addWord function whether it should be printing the "added at beginning" and "added first word" messages. It's especially annoying for loading files, but otherwise, it's wanted.

    • head

      VocabList.VocabNode head

    • tail

      VocabList.VocabNode tail

  • Constructor Details

    • VocabList

      public VocabList()

  • Method Details

    • addWordToVocab

      public void addWordToVocab(String vocabTopic, String word)
      Adds a specified word to a specified topic. Validation of whether the word is already under the existing topic is done outside.
      Parameters:
      vocabTopic - the topic to add to
      word - the word to add

    • insertTopicBefore

      public void insertTopicBefore(VocabList.VocabNode beforeVoc, String topic)
      Operation on doubly-linked list inserting a topic before one specified by the user.
      Parameters:
      beforeVoc - the node before which we are trying to insert a new topic
      topic - the topic to insert

    • findNodeByTopic

      public VocabList.VocabNode findNodeByTopic(String topic)

    • insertTopicAfter

      public void insertTopicAfter(VocabList.VocabNode afterVoc, String topic)
      Operation on doubly-linked list inserting a topic after one specified by the user.
      Parameters:
      afterVoc - the node after which we are trying to insert a new topic
      topic - the topic to insert

    • printVocabList

      public void printVocabList()
      Prints the vocab list, topic by topic with their associated index.

    • removeVocab

      public void removeVocab(VocabList.VocabNode vocabToRemove)
      Removes a vocab node from a vocab list, equivalent to getting rid of a topic.
      Parameters:
      vocabToRemove - the vocab node associated to the topic to remove.

    • addInitialTopic

      public void addInitialTopic(String topic)
      Creates the initial node for the VocabList. Called upon when trying to insert before or after in an empty list.
      Parameters:
      topic - the topic to add.

    • getTopic

      public String getTopic(VocabList.VocabNode node)
      returns the topic of a given VocabNode.
      Parameters:
      node - the node to retrieve the topic from.
      Returns:
      the topic.

    • getVocabObjectAtIndex

      public VocabList.Vocab getVocabObjectAtIndex(int index)
      Indexes vocab objects and retrieves the one asked for by the user, specified through a passed integer index.
      Parameters:
      index - the index of the desired vocab object.
      Returns:
      the vocab object from the list associated to the passed index.

    • getVocabNodeWithTopicName

      public VocabList.VocabNode getVocabNodeWithTopicName(String topic)
      Used to retrieve a vocab node associated to a passed topic name. Only use is for cleansing duplicates within a specific topic (namely the one created in insertAfter and insertBefore).
      Parameters:
      topic - the name of the topic associated with the VocabNode to look for
      Returns:
      the Vocab node associated to the topic.

    • getSize

      public int getSize()
      Retrieves the size of the VocabList. YES, THE MORE OPTIMAL SOLUTION WOULD BE A COUNTER.
      Returns:
      the number of nodes in the VocabList.

    • searchWordInVocab

      public void searchWordInVocab(String word)
      Parses through all vocabs and prints each instance of the passed word found within the lists.
      Parameters:
      word - the word to search for.

    • searchLetterInVocab

      public void searchLetterInVocab(String letter)
      Runs searchForLetter() on every existing vocab in the list. Functionally it goes through every vocab object and seeks out words that start with a given letter.
      Parameters:
      letter - the letter to check for at the start of the words.

    • writeToFile

      public void writeToFile(String filePath)
      Writes the VocabList, word by word and topic by topic to a file with a format that can be reused as input.
      Parameters:
      filePath - the filepath/name to write to.

    • cleanseDuplicates

      public void cleanseDuplicates()
      Removes all existing duplicate words in a vocab list.
